characters.name: Ivy Merrin
characters.appearance: thin, quick; dark hair; scuffed boots; brass transit token on a cord; often smells faintly of chalk dust and sea air
characters.voice: curious, plain-spoken; short sentences under stress; wry humor with friends
characters.wants: Find the truth about her mother's disappearance and keep Aunt June and Greywater safe
characters.needs: Choose the living over longing; accept help and trust allies
characters.fears: Opening a seam too wide; losing the people who took her in
characters.arc: Reluctant novice → tested apprentice → responsible Warden who binds the Keystone and accepts a permanent route
continuity: First seen Ch1 arriving at Greywater rowhouse
Finds brass transit token embedded in doorframe crack (Ch1)
Instinctive salt ring at laundromat wind incident (Ch3)
Formally joins Night Wardens (Ch5)
Attunes Keystone with heartbeat cadence (Ch21)
Chooses to bind Veil rather than keep breach open to hear mother (Ch22)
Granted official route by Ms. Kestrel (Ch24)

characters.name: June Merrin
characters.role: Aunt/guardian; seamstress who keeps old rowhouse and neighborhood stitched together
characters.appearance: broad-shouldered; rolled sleeves; hair pinned with sewing needles; salt kept in a tea tin by the door
characters.voice: plain, protective, sometimes sharp from worry
characters.wants: Keep Ivy safe and away from the dangers that took Ivy’s mother
characters.needs: Accept that Ivy’s gift is part of who she is
characters.fears: The city ‘taking what it’s owed’ again
characters.arc: From forbidding Warden work to backing Ivy’s choice and sharing letters from Ivy’s mother
continuity: Sprinkles salt across threshold in opening scene (Ch1)
Reveals Ivy’s mother’s Warden history (Ch12)
Gives sealed letters at the end (Ch24)

characters.name: Button
characters.role: One-eyed stray dog; companion and quiet barometer for seams
characters.appearance: shaggy brown mutt; left eye clouded; collar made from old lampwick
characters.voice: nonverbal; communicates through posture and attention to hums
characters.wants: Stay with Ivy; avoid the cold wind that smells like wet paper
characters.needs: Security and routine after street years
characters.fears: River promenade when seams tug at crowds
characters.arc: Stray to library dog; becomes unofficial mascot of the Wardens
continuity: Begins following Ivy in Ch2
Holds position inside chalk rings reliably by mid-book
Adopted as library dog after climax (Ch23)

characters.name: Ms. Kestrel
characters.appearance: sharp-eyed; hair streaked with silver; ink-stained fingers; carries a sun-warmed brass lantern
characters.voice: measured, wry, specific; avoids metaphors; dislikes gossip
characters.wants: Hold the Veil and keep the Wardens respected in public life
characters.needs: Trust new blood and let instinct inform method
characters.fears: Public backlash; repeating the loss tied to Ivy’s mother
characters.arc: Guarded gatekeeper → pragmatic leader who empowers Ivy

relationships.label: old friend
relationships.tension: blame for the past vs shared grief

continuity: Binds laundromat wind with chalk sigil (Ch3)
Initiates Ivy (Ch5)
Detained on permit violation (Ch13)
Signals coordinates via lamppost blink code (Ch16)
Arrives with legal orders to arrest Bram (Ch22)
Grants Ivy a formal route (Ch24)

characters.name: Tamsin Park
characters.appearance: short, practical haircut; oil under nails; patched satchel with spools of wire
characters.voice: quick, dry, solution-first; jokes under pressure
characters.wants: Keep her family’s repair shop afloat; prove craft can save lives
characters.needs: Ask for help before problems get dangerous
characters.fears: Letting people down when things break
characters.arc: From clever sidekick to indispensable craft lead who earns a paid apprenticeship
continuity: Receives kit with Ivy and Rooke (Ch5)
Designs river promenade lattice (Ch9)
Sketches gear reroute plans in City Works tunnels (Ch14–16)
Jams tower gear during climax (Ch21)
Awarded city lamp-grid apprenticeship (Ch23)

characters.name: Noah “Rooke”
characters.role: Warden trainee; quietly brave; struggles with deep water
characters.appearance: tall, narrow; sleeves too short; wears a knotted cord as a reminder to breathe
characters.voice: gentle, literal; speaks only when needed
characters.wants: Be useful and not freeze near the tide tunnels
characters.needs: Trust his body under fear; accept that bravery looks like small steps
characters.fears: Dark water; being the reason someone drowns
characters.arc: Hesitant trainee → rescuer who rings the bell early and starts swim classes after
continuity: Helps haul teen from river promenade (Ch9)
Crosses siphon in Glazier’s Tunnel despite fear (Ch15)
Rings bell early to break Bram’s timing (Ch21)
Enrolls in swim class after (Ch23)

characters.name: Cole Archer
characters.role: Senior trainee; status-conscious rival who leaks a map to the Council
characters.appearance: neat uniform; perfect chalk lines; too-new boots
characters.voice: confident in public; defensive when challenged
characters.wants: Recognition; to be the one who ‘saves the city’
characters.needs: Humility; courage not based on applause
characters.fears: Being sidelined; being wrong in public
characters.arc: From swaggering antagonist-lite → remorseful ally who helps at the tower and accepts discipline
continuity: Needles Ivy on first routes (Ch7)
Leaks Warden map to Council under ‘safety’ pretext (Ch13)
Wavers at tower then aids Ivy and team (Ch19–21)
Faces Warden discipline; apologizes sincerely (Ch23)

characters.name: Bram Dore
characters.role: Antagonist; popular councilman engineering a Keystone hijack via Founders’ Week
characters.voice: warm on the stump, clipped and technical in private
characters.wants: Harness the Keystone to centralize power and make Greywater ‘safe’ on his terms
characters.needs: Accept limits and the city’s living will
characters.fears: Irrelevance; losing control of the narrative
characters.arc: Civic darling → exposed saboteur; arrested after the failed hijack
continuity: Pushes Founders’ Week spectacle, restricts lamp work (Ch10)
Has Kestrel detained on permit technicality (Ch13)
Conduit discovered under City Works (Ch14–16)
Offers Ivy a bargain to reach her mother’s voice (Ch18)
Attempt hijack during Midnight Toll (Ch20–21)
Arrested when Veil is bound (Ch22)

characters.name: Edna Pike
characters.role: Historical Warden; author of the Pike Diary that describes the Keystone Lantern
characters.appearance: seen only in archival sketches: stout boots, oil cloak, brass notebook
characters.voice: pragmatic and laconic in diary excerpts
characters.wants: Anchor the city’s Veil reliably after early lamplighter failures
characters.needs: A successor who can ‘listen’ rather than merely measure
characters.fears: Civic tampering with the Keystone during celebrations
characters.arc: Posthumous mentor through her writings; proves a Listener must wake the Keystone
continuity: Diary found in deep archives (Ch11)
Sketch of brass token matches Ivy’s (Ch11)
Keystone notes decode route to sub-basement (Ch16)

characters.name: Mara Quill
characters.role: Council aide and fixer for Bram Dore
characters.appearance: navy coat; shorthand pad; lantern-sigil lapel pin (copy)
characters.voice: crisp, efficient; conceals nerves with precision
characters.wants: Career stability under Bram’s rising star
characters.needs: Recognize complicity; choose whistle over loyalty
characters.arc: From loyal aide to reluctant witness who turns state’s evidence after the arrest
continuity: Seen passing a copied lantern sigil among staffers (Ch13)
Subpoenaed after Ch22; provides conduit invoices

characters.name: Sergeant Alden Morrow
characters.role: Police sergeant who executes Bram’s ‘public order’ detentions
characters.appearance: oilskin cape; heavy keys; tired eyes
characters.needs: Draw a line where law is abused
characters.fears: Becoming the face of a bad order
characters.arc: Enforcer to reluctant cooperator; stands down during the arrest
continuity: Leads detention of Kestrel (Ch13)
Holds perimeter at clocktower during Midnight Toll (Ch20–21)
Does not obstruct legal orders at end (Ch22)

characters.name: Ephraim Carrow
characters.role: Clocktower caretaker; knows the gear ladders and bell access
characters.appearance: lantern soot in pores; ring of keys; limp from old fall
characters.voice: slow, gravelly; fond of the bell like a person
characters.wants: Keep the bell true and the tower safe
characters.needs: Trust the Wardens when politics intrude
characters.fears: Bell misstrike cracking the tower stone
characters.arc: Cautious outsider → ally who props a service door at critical moment
continuity: Gives a gruff warning about tampering (Ch8/11 implied)
Lets team into sub-basement during Founders’ noise (Ch18–19)

characters.name: Tilda Weir
characters.role: Library aide; manages archive keys and late notices
characters.appearance: cardigan with ink blots; pencil behind ear
characters.voice: bright, whisper-fast; rules stickler unless persuaded
skills: quietly moving boxes no one asked about
characters.wants: Keep her job; keep the archive orderly
characters.needs: Courage to ‘lose’ a key for the right reason
characters.arc: From timid rule-keeper to small act of defiance aiding the Wardens
continuity: Helps Ivy access deep archives for Pike diary (Ch11)
Covers for Kestrel’s absence during detention (Ch13)
